author: Adam Barnhardt
title: [SPOILER] Leaves Supergirl
text:
0 comments 
This article contains spoilers regarding tonight’s episode of Supergirl . 
Over the course of tonight’s episode of Supergirl, ‘The Martian Chronicles,’ we saw Team Supergirl take on not only one, but two White Martians. Upon defeating the White Martians, we see M’gann M’orrz, Miss Martian (Sharon Leal) herself leave the show. 
The character, a major player in Geoff Johns's run on Teen Titans, M’orrz is probably best known to TV audiences from her appearances on the animated cult hit Young Justice. 
In addition to her time as Miss Martian on Supergirl, Leal has a number of notable credits to her name, including multi-episode arcs on Private Practice, Hellcats, and Grimm. 
M'gann is actually a White Martian who decided to become "good" and elected to look like a Green Martian instead. The concept of White Martians was introduced in the eleventh episode of Supergirl's first season, when Martian Manhunter had to face one down. 
There had been some speculation that due to the on-again, off-again Titans series that Warner Bros. Television was trying to develop, Miss Martian may have been off the table for Supergirl. While at one point it didn't look like a Titans series would materialize, M'gann's depature from Supergirl may reopen those questions. 
MORE: Supergirl: Who Is Armek? / Supergirl Recap with Spoilers - The Martian Chronicles / Supergirl Season 2 Episode 11: The Martian Chronicles Featurette 
Distributed worldwide by Warner Bros. International Television Distribution, SUPERGIRL is executive produced by Greg Berlanti ( Arrow, The Flash ), Ali Adler ( The New Normal ), Andrew Kreisberg ( The Flash, Arrow ) and Sarah Schechter ( Blindspot, The Mysteries of Laura ). Supergirl is based on the characters created by Jerry Siegel and Joe Shuster and appearing in DC Comics, by special arrangement with the Jerry Siegel Family. 
"Luthors" episode of Supergirl will air Monday, February 13 at 8 p.m. ET/PT on The CW.
